metadata.title: CVE-2018-13302 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In FFmpeg 4.0.1, improper handling of frame types (other thanEAC3_FRAME_TYPE_INDEPENDENT) that have multiple independent substreams inthe handle_eac3 function in libavformat/movenc.c may trigger anout-of-array access while converting a crafted AVI file to MPEG4, leadingto a denial of service or possibly unspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavcodec58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavdevice58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavfilter7 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat-extra - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavformat58 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libavutil56 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libpostproc55 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libswresample3 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
libswscale5 - 7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:4.0.2-1ubuntu6').
mythtv package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
gst-libav1.0 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
kino package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
